page.title: 07Denaby Ings
page.content: {Denaby Ings} {Ecology}is increasingly important in the area.{Denaby Ings}is one of the many nature reserves controlled by the {Yorkshire Naturalists Trust.}It is a big place. It has two big lakes, it also has lots of trees and plants. It is next to the River Dearne. There are all kinds of water life; plants, animals, insects, birds. People go there for bird-watching in the three hides. It is a very interesting place. There are both full time and{voluteer} {wardens}working there. There is a field station and information on the things you might see there. More and more people in the area seem to be taking an interest in the natural history of the area, and other reclamation areas and similar projects are mushrooming.
